Meeting Memos:

Meeting Memo

Summary:
Team agreed to pause other customer work and concentrate on getting ambient task extraction production-ready for internal use, aiming to demo a ‘vibe-working’ loop where 70 % of PRs are merged automatically. Evangeline will finish two customer calls this week, while Karen takes full ownership of extraction quality, Kumail builds a robust eval framework and fixes connector issues, Johnny defines what a “good” ticket looks like for coding agents, and David adds Notion-doc support and resolves the ingestion-race causing duplicates. Success hinges on high-accuracy evals and quick feedback loops; unresolved is an easy UI for adding real-world artifacts to the eval set.

Notes:

Project Focus & Vision:
  - Shift all effort to high-quality ambient extraction as foundation for ‘vibe-working’ demo
  - Goal: internal system that handles ~70 % of PRs automatically, then public demo video
  - Triage-bot line of work put on hold except bug fixes

Off-boarding & Customer Calls:
  - Evangeline exits day-to-day work; two Linear feedback calls (Zena & Komi) still on calendar this week
  - No other explicit off-boarding tasks for now

Quality & Eval Framework:
  - Need comprehensive end-to-end evals for Slack, meetings, GitHub; meetings seen as hardest
  - Karen already built GitHub eval prototype; Kumail to create fake datasets for Slack/meetings and port old evals
  - Desire for quick way to turn live artifacts into eval datapoints to avoid future blind spots

Ticket Format & Coding Agent Integration:
  - Extracted tickets currently too sparse; richer context raises agent success rate
  - Johnny to experiment with triage-style prompt and define ‘good ticket’ spec
  - False negatives more critical than occasional duplicates; focus on context & accuracy

Work Allocation & Timeline:
  - Karen becomes overall quality owner while Kumail travels Wed–Fri
  - Goal: resolve all red-flag quality issues by week’s end, but risk lies in labeling sufficient eval data
  - Phillip & Kumail in Bay Area mid-week; others expected to drive work independently

Infrastructure & Connector Issues:
  - Staging now running; config editable via UI
  - Grapevine QA stand-up artifact failed—needs investigation
  - Slack/Linear duplication caused by ingestion lag; proposed fix: also query Linear API
  - Request to restore Slack channel that logs artifact → ticket activity for visibility

Action Items:

  - description='Create fake datasets and end-to-end evals for Slack and meeting transcripts' due_date=None assignee='Kumail'
  - description='Investigate and fix Grapevine QA stand-up extraction failure' due_date=None assignee='Kumail'
  - description='Re-enable Slack notifications that post every artifact and resulting ticket update' due_date=None assignee='Kumail'
  - description='Own ambient-extraction quality and red issues while Kumail is away' due_date=None assignee='Karen'
  - description='Separate Ask-Agent code from main eval loop to keep tests fast' due_date=None assignee='Karen'
  - description='Define criteria for ‘good’ engineering tickets and test with coding agents' due_date=None assignee='JohnnyD'
  - description='Add experimental code/tests for ticket-quality experiments without slowing core evals' due_date=None assignee='JohnnyD'
  - description='Implement Notion document processor & prompt, then integrate into extraction pipeline' due_date=None assignee='David R'
  - description='Resolve ingestion race by combining Grapevine search with Linear API to avoid duplicate tickets' due_date=None assignee='David R'
  - description='(maybe?) Build quick UI or shortcut to log any live artifact as a new eval datapoint' due_date=None assignee=''
